title: What's this for?
messages: This really is just a big excuse for me to learn Vue
Don't expect this to be good or anything
We have a huge hurdle to get through

title: Hurdle?
messages: Yes, there's a serious problem preventing this project from being what I wanted it to be
What I wanted was that this could be a client-side application that would be able to make requests at will
I wanted to provide freedom in a platform to simulate requests like Postman, but without all the crap

title: Requests?
messages: Bouncedat is a platform for making post requests, the project goal is to emulate cURL in a browser using a user interface
The goals for the interface are simply to allow endpoint analysis and saving of the collected data for the session
Then you can save those requests to your account

title: But wasn't there a problem preventing this?
messages: The problem is that when you're making a request from this site, bouncedat.com, your browser must make a preflight request to ensure that the target server accepts a request of a cross-origin-domain
CORS is the enemy, and this platform will use a VueJS application that opens a websocket to a request translator

The translator will magically make the request for you in a way that won't bother CORS, and then you can get the response. This will be an excellent tool for API analysis, especially when the target API has the wrong cross-origin headers

title: Sounds Dangerous
messages: It is.
The potential for abuse of such a tool like this is quite high
You are free to create an account and make requests within the quota

title: Quota?
messages: The quota of alotted requests allowed through the Bouncedat service will be limited per hour, which will reset at the top of each hour
The hourly quota may change from time to time based on server load
Be nice, it should be quite difficult to reach your hourly quota

title: Will you spy on me? Is it safe?
messages: By the very nature of Bouncedat, your requests are saved to the server in a form that allows the application to retrieve your past requests upon login
If you delete a request from your history, it is not removed from the server logs
Please do not use Bouncedat for any illegal activity, your account will be terminated if you are found to be using the service for nefarious deeds
